message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with learning local geometric descriptors from RGB-D reconstructions, which is a problem commonly studied in computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed method is also applicable to robotics (cs.RO) for tasks such as object recognition and manipulation. The paper heavily relies on machine learning techniques, specifically deep learning, to learn the local volumetric patch descriptor, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The proposed method can also be used for mesh surface correspondence, which is a problem in computer graphics (cs.GR). Finally, the paper proposes a self-supervised feature learning method, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
